main event: A civilian observer reported seeing an unidentified flying object resembling the planet Jupiter over York, Pennsylvania on October 13, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 12 seconds at an altitude of about 50Â° and 60,000 feet,The object initially moved in an easterly direction before turning south,The observer did not hear any sound from the object,The report could not obtain sufficient data for a conclusive evaluation, and the object appeared as a solid yellow-orange orb without any gaseous halo or running lights.
sighted object: unidentified flying object resembling planet Jupiter
